exceptions.exn: In environment X : Type x, y : X A : list X H : forall (x : X) A, x :: A <<= x :: x :: A Unable to unify "forall a : X, a el ?M1656 :: ?M1657 -> a el ?M1656 :: ?M1656 :: ?M1657" with "x :: y :: A <<= y :: x :: A /\\ y :: x :: A <<= x :: y :: A".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
y: X
x: X
A: list X

Goal:
x :: y :: A === y :: x :: A

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
equi_dup : forall (x : X) A, x :: A === x :: x :: A
equi_push : forall (x : X) A, x el A -> A === x :: A
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
Relation_Operators.Ltl_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P [] (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0
Relation_Operators.Ltl_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P [] (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0
Relation_Operators.Lt_tl : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y)
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), [] <> x ++ a :: y
count_occ_cons_neq : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x <> y -> count_occ eq_dec (x :: l) y = count_occ eq_dec l y
count_occ_cons_eq : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x = y -> count_occ eq_dec (x :: l) y = S (count_occ eq_dec l y)
incl_sing : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A : list X) (y : X), x :: A <<= [y] -> x = y /\ A <<= [y]
Inductive Ltl (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA [] (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y) | Lt_tl : forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Relation_Operators.Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
Relation_Operators.Lt_hd : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A), leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y)
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = [a] -> x = [] /\ y = [a] \/ x = [a] /\ y = []
Inductive clos_refl (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := r_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl A R x y | r_refl : Relation_Operators.clos_refl A R x x Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_refl _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.r_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.r_refl _%type_scope
Forall2_cons : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l')
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
remove_cons : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (x : A) (l : list A), remove eq_dec x (x :: l) = remove eq_dec x l
rev_app_distr : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A), rev (x ++ y) = rev y ++ rev x
in_sing : forall (X : Type) (x y : X), x el [y] -> x = y
Relation_Operators.d_conc : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])
count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
incl_shift : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), A <<= B -> x :: A <<= x :: B
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Forall2_ind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> Prop), P [] [] -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
Forall2_sind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> SProp), P [] [] -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
list_cycle : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (x : X), x :: A <> A
Inductive Forall2 (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) : list A -> list B -> Prop := Forall2_nil : Forall2 R [] [] | Forall2_cons : forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l') Arguments Forall2 [A B]%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Forall2_nil [A B]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Forall2_cons [A B]%type_scope [R]%function_scope _ _ [l l']%list_scope
Inductive Desc (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Relation_Operators.Desc A leA [] | d_one : forall x : A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA [x] | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x]) Arguments Relation_Operators.Desc _%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_conc _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
List.list_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall l l' : list A, {l = l'} + {l <> l'}
incl_lcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), x :: A <<= B < -> x el B /\ A <<= B
in_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (a : A) (l : list A), {a el l} + {~ a el l}
destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = x :: tl}} + {l = []}
map_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (x : A) (l : list A), map f (x :: l) = f x :: map f l
in_elt : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l1 l2 : list A), x el l1 ++ x :: l2
Exists_cons_hd : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Exists P (x :: l)
in_split : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), x el l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ x :: l2
List.not_in_cons : forall (A : Type) (x a : A) (l : list A), ~ x el a :: l < -> x <> a /\ ~ x el l
